Key Match Events: Yordan Alvarez homered twice as the Houston Astros completed a four-game sweep of the Kansas City Royals with a 7-2 win.
Jon Singleton added a two-run shot as the Astros took the lead in the fourth inning.
Bobby Witt Jr. homered to left in the seventh inning for the Royals' only other run.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros completed a four-game sweep of the Royals, their first sweep of the season.
The game was played at Daikin Park in Houston, Texas, with an attendance of 40,229.
The Astros' win improved their record to 75-62, while the Royals fell to 75-63.
Others: Ronel Blanco pitched 5.0 innings for the Astros, allowing 3 hits and 0 ER, with 3 K and 4 BB.
Alec Marsh pitched 5.0 innings for the Royals, allowing 4 hits and 3 ER, with 5 K and 1 BB.
